Headline: Founder-Pee Safe | Enabling better hygiene for you since 2013
Comment: Dilip, I am glad we had this chat yesterday on the present situation of Menstrual Hygiene in India. We definitely need more men to come forward and make this into regular chats.

Headline: Building the Luna Ring | Prev: Founder at SocialBoat (acq. by Noise)
Comment:
We did a Menstrual Health Survey recently - 68% women felt uncomfortable talking to male members in the family. Less than 7% were taught about menstruation in schools. 

Educate in Schools - so boys and girls get the right conditioning from their childhood. 

Empower in Families - so we all know it is nothing to be ashamed of

Headline: Entrepreneur | 3x SaaS CoFounder | GenAI | HR Leader and Consultant | Global Motivational Speaker | Podcast Host | Mentor | Brand Builder | Leadership Coach | Proud Mom on a Mission âœ¨
Comment: I was always shy to talk about menstruation, pads, and cramps with my father. Why? You can call it social conditioning. But, now I have a daughter, who is but very young. So, now I am sensitizing my husband. When the time comes, may he be empowered to support his little girl. Every family needs to come together to break this taboo and stigma.

Headline: NBC- HWC I Unlocking the real you
Comment: so beautiful .... though my dad was very open to this discussion ....my neighbourhood/society wasnt .. i had to figure out so much myself

Headline: Go from Offline to Pipeline
Comment: Such an important topic to be discussed with daughters. Thanks for sharing the video Dilip Kumar

Headline: Author | Your 'Idea to Enterprise' Guy | Making sense of Entrepreneurship for early stage founders | Supporting student founders | Myrah's Dad
Comment: What a beautiful post Dilip Kumar. My daughter, almost 12 years now, speaks very openly to me about cramps, pantyliners, brand choices etc. We started our conversation with Aditi Gupta's book https://www.menstrupedia.com/. Menstrupedia gave her the confidence to be ready and also talk about it openly with me and also with her cousins and friends. It builds a different Father- Daughter bond.
